entry.title: Combined summary - Fwd: death by halving
entry.summary: In 2014, Gavin Andresen and Ferdinando M. Ametrano had an email exchange about the potential differences in the upcoming bitcoin halving event compared to the previous one. Ametrano pointed out that the ecosystem was younger during the first halving in November 2008, which occurred during a stable price trend. While halving is not strictly necessary to follow Nakamoto's monetary rule, many people have planned around its current behavior, which has not caused any problems. Additionally, there are potential benefits such as encouraging investment in mining infrastructure. Ametrano considered the discussion a waste of time and emphasized the complexity of the system beyond the subsidy schedule.
